term.name: Yangism
term.source: From the name of the Chinese philosopher Yang Zhu (440–360 BCE).
term.def: A school of philosophy comparable to the later school &epicureanism; and that influenced &taoism;. It held that satisfying one's own desires was the most important pursuit one could maintain, as long as one did not cause harm to himself. It rejected the beliefs of &legalism;, &confucianism;, and &mohism;, competing philosophies at the time.
